availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, saddler. Native of Ireland. Married to Jane Kennan McGrath. Father of Elizabeth McGrath, John E. McGrath, Catherine "Kate" McGrath, and Ann McGrath. Immigrated to the United States in 1849. Resident of Clark County, Kentucky, in 1853. Harness maker in Clark County in 1860. Member of the Winchester Home Guard in 1862. Saddler in Clark County in 1863. Farmer in Carroll County, Missouri, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester District 2, p. 884.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Saline County, Marshall Township, p. 159B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 9.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994031, Clark County Births.
History of Saline County, Missouri: Carefully Written and Compiled from the Most Authentic Official and Private Sources, (St. Louis, MO: Missouri Historical Company, 1881): pp. 766-767.
"Daniel McGrath (1824-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial 77589900, accessed November 30, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77589900.
